reviews.cmt: Its amazing to see how much you actually overeat when it comes to calories. Diet is 90% of the effort in weight control. Slogging it in the gym helps but isn\'t the key. Would give 5 stars if they had a setting to use kg with miles. Instead of having to use a separate app for conversion. Food tracker widget is also poor quality, looks like a child drew it. Customer service I don\'t think they have heard of either.

Its changed so much.  I got it originally for the food journal, but fell in love with the weight graph, and forum, and the many different articles I was delivered each day.  It helped me to live healthier. Now, noom is almost unrecognizable to me. The forum is gone, so no more dozens of topics to talk about.  We only get one article, the rest aren\'t available unless we pay . Hate it. Everything is about going pro! $10 a month? Smh.

reviews.t: Lost data and paid for pro
reviews.cmt: Paid for pro which meant I have lost my data and didny get upgraded.  Their customer service doesn\'t respond to emails
Its a really helpful app with lots of curiosities and tips every day but it doesnt count the steps properly. But in overall it is great. I totally reccomend it!

Still one of the best but needs better database for food like FitnessPal and the weight graph is not motivating.  You lose 2 kg and it is still flat and the message is just \"great, keep it up\" could be more interactive.  The widget is also useless. Overall not bad

I wish noom included a water intake tracker. Also, calorie density is a great way to watch what you\'re eating, but some healthier foods like flaxseed show up red because of their density among other foods that are mostly unhealthy.  You can\'t rely on the app to know that your diet is healthy, you still have to do some research.  Fitness log is great but I wonder about the accuracy of calorie counts per exercise.  I\'m not willing to spend $10/month on pro, but free app could have more features.

Since more than 2 years ago I have not had the conviction to follow a diet, not the way that I used to do it. Suddenly I found this amazing app that helps me to get motivated and learn more about the food, it also helps me to stay focus on my goal. I just fell in love with this app. I only have a week trying it and I lost almost 7 lbs.

reviews.t: Makes losing weight fun and productive!
reviews.cmt: I am not extremely overweight but I do eat unhealthy, and that becomes a problem later in life. With this app you can buckle down, diet like a fitness-freak and have fun while you\'re doing it. What I like the most is how it encourages you to be the best you can be and how you can log the food  you eat. Other apps require pay to just TRY IT and that doesn\'t make anyone want to work out, but with Noom you\'ll want to eat healthy, you\'ll want to look forward to exercising and you WILL lose weight!
Its way too power consuming. Fix this and 5 stars will be yours ^.^
Good motivation with the daily tasks, alerts to put in your meals are great as I always forget. Bit unsure at how accurate the pedometer is but I like that at works non-stop.
Helps show wat u have eaten along with exercise log. Gives u steps to keep u on right track.
It is much better if only you .  also. . add more kfc, jollibee or chowking menus
Simple, easy and smart. It really helps you to become disciplined and maintain a helthy weight.

Great app....BUT NEVER FINDS BARCODE WHEN I SCAN! UPDATE OR I WILL HAVE TO UNINSTALL.....MY SON HAS MY FITNESS PAL ...WE COMPETE...AND I LOSE! I MAY SWITCH IF YOU DON\'T UPDATE YOUR BARCODE...CAN\'T FINDS STEAMFRESH VEGETABLES? ?? COME ON!!!

reviews.t: $10 a MONTH! for the Pro app?
reviews.cmt: I really love this app, but the main reason I downloaded this app was for the recipes. I was right on my way to purchase the Pro Version (which I thought was about $1.99) and then I saw it was $10 a month!. This is crazy and really overpriced. You should atleast have a few new recipes each day for the free version. 3 stars for the app itself, cause I really enjoy it. 2 stars for not having the recipes available to the free users and for being overpriced.

It looks like a really nice app thus far, yet I think it was designed more for phones in mind than tablets. When adding foods, the sidebar overlaps the search options, so it\'s hard to know what I\'m selecting. Also, a tablet is not as easy to carry about on walks and runs, so perhaps an option to use a different pedometer and later input your steps? Although this may be unnecessary as you can input several exercise options including walking and running. Overall, I like it, but things need work.
I\'ve been using it for a week now and I like it very much so far! Haven\'t loose any kgs yet but it helps to choose what you eat... Recommend
It used to be a great app before the forums were taken away it\'s just like every other calorie tracking app now.
Only big complaint is that you have to log your weight to see the weight graph.
wonderful application,  helpt me to reach and ceep my ideal weight
